title: EPA GEO Records

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: EPA GEO Records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Description of Records Sought:
Category 1: Adelanto 2020 Spartan Chemical Report 
1.a All appendices and any other EPA records referenced in, relating to, or reviewed in preparation of the Region 9 Enforcement Division’s inspection report dated December 4, 2020, and signed by Inspector Hyles, available here: https://earthjustice.org/sites/default/files/files/final_inspection_report_1.pdf

1.b Any EPA FOIA log entries and a list of FOIA records already released by EPA regarding this Inspection Report 

1.c Any follow-up correspondence between GEO and EPA regarding this inspection report. 

Category 2: Tacoma HDQ Neutral Warning
2.a Any reports, findings appendices, or other records that led to this FIFRA warning letter, signed July 6, 2021, by the Chief of the EPA air and land enforcement branch GEO Tacoma Facility Administrator Bruce Scott. https://drive.google.com/file/d/1dFpHxm43mlTuQRMMYDzjZMPSX7A_0Mr_/view?usp=drivesdk which is referenced in this article: https://www.knkx.org/news/2021-07-15/epa-warns-private-prison-company-about-pesticide-misuse-at-tacoma-ice-facility

2.b Any EPA FOIA Log or FOIA release regarding the EPA’s letter to GEO regarding Tacoma 

2.c Any follow up correspondence between GEO and EPA regarding this warning letter. 

Category 3: Other EPA Actions at ICE Contracted Facilities 

3.a Please provide all communications between EPA and GEO regarding potential violations, warnings, or inspections sent or received from December 2020 to the date on which EPA tasks an adequate search. 

3.b Please provide any record showing the total number of epa investigations at ice-contracted facilities since January 2017. 

Thank you,
Andrew Free
#DetentionKills Transparency Initiative 
Al Otro Lado

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

title: Texas Freedom of Information Act. Request: Texas Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (Midwestern State University)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Texas Freedom of Information Act. Request: Texas Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (Midwestern State University)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the { Texas Freedom of Information Act. }, I hereby request the following records:

- A copy of any and all contracts (including associated amendments and exhibits) awarded to Pepsi, Coca-Cola, or any subdivision thereof, for the provision of beverages or other goods in any facilities under the purview of this organization, including all activities and buildings associated with athletics, sports, dining services, or otherwise. If this agency does not have a contract with either of the named companies, please provide the equivalent agreement with the currently employed company.
- If the contract(s) was cancelled, any and all materials related to its cancellation.
- If the contract was cancelled, the statement from the university about cancellation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within { 5 days }.

Sincerely,

{ Kayla Henson }

communications.communication:

communications.communication:

I have attached the letter of explanation, and redacted copy of the Agreement that I will be sending to the Attorney General as requested.

I am including Kayla Hensen (139625-32631596@requests.muckrock.com<mailto:139625-32631596@requests.muckrock.com>) on this email, as required in the request, and including Candace Norrod as well.

Please let us know if you have any further questions.




Matthew Karabinus | PepsiCo , Inc. | Legal Assistant
1100 Reynolds Blvd Winston-Salem, NC 27105 |  matthew.karabinus@pepsico.com<mailto:Matthew.Karabinus@Pepsi.com>

This electronic mail message and its contents are intended only for the use of the addressed recipient/s and may contain information that is privileged, confidential and exempt from disclosure under applicable law. If you are not an intended recipient, or the agent responsible for delivering this email to the intended recipient/s, you are hereby notified that any use, dissemination, distribution, or copying of this communication is strictly prohibited and may be unlawful. If you received this email in error, please notify the sender immediately, by replying to this email and delete the email sent in error.

communications.subject: Public Records Request - Coca Cola contract
communications.communication:
Good morning, Kayla -

Please allow this email to serve as acknowledgment of your public records request.  I have contacted the appropriate department(s) to collect any existing responsive public records to your request. Once any records have been collected and our office has conducted its legal review of such records, we will provide a response to you.

In the meantime, if you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact me.

Thank you -

Adam J. Motycka, J.D.
Assistant General Counsel - Records Compliance
Office of Legal Affairs
2801 W. Bancroft St.
Toledo, OH 43606-3390

communications.subject: RE: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Ohio Freedom of Information Act. Request: Ohio Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (University Of Toledo)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following Ohio Open Records Law request, copied below, and originally submitted on Jan. 23, 2023. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] RE: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Ohio Freedom of Information Act. Request: Ohio Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (University Of Toledo)
communications.communication:
Good afternoon, Kayla –

We have a contractual obligation to inform the Company when a public records request for a copy of contract has been made, and they can utilize that time to obtain a court order prohibiting us from releasing any trade secret and/or confidential information.  That was the reason for the delay.

Please find attached the responsive record to your request.  I trust that the attached record fulfills your request, but if not, or if you need anything further, please let our office know.
Best,

Adam J. Motycka, J.D.
Assistant General Counsel – Records Compliance
Office of Legal Affairs
2801 W. Bancroft St.
Toledo, OH 43606-3390

communications.communication: That Sherre Johnston is in jail with a case pending is a great excuse when the real problem is HOW many times Sherre's been "handled", and let go because she is the Sheriff's girlfriend AND because of the events of september 2, 2015 when Mike McNamara, the Sheriff's brother died in her arms. THIS has gotten her off of DWI's, burglary of the Sheriff's shed, harassing a tv reporter and other people, and most recently burglary of another habitation. The City of Robinson's legal representative, Lawyer Dixon, is used to protecting his other client, Sheriff McNamara from all things Sherre Johnston so it is no wonder that this request has gone on this long.  It is also why the Sheriff's department is the only Department in the State of Texas that does not have body cameras. NO body cams keep the Sheriff's people from recording Sherre screaming for Parnell. Unfortunately, Robinson, like everyone else, HAS body cams. These will prove as has been proven over and over again, that the woman has a get out of jail free cards because she's the Sheriff's girlfriend. Ask them.

title: "Air Permit Tracking System" database

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: "Air Permit Tracking System" database
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

The raw data or database - in a machine-readable database or spreadsheet format such as Excel, CSV, Access, SQL or XML - that serves as the backend for Illinois' "Air Permit Tracking System," found at the following link: https://www2.illinois.gov/epa/topics/forms/air-permits/Pages/default.aspx. 

The data should include all fields in the database or spreadsheets that contain non-exempt information, including but no limited to all fields in the example for provided by the Illinois EPA website and submitted with this request. I also request all documentation that describes the layout of the database’s tables and fields, and that provides the definitions of any field names, codes, and abbreviations used in the database. This information may be gathered together in a single document like a data dictionary, entity layout, or user's guide. If that is the case, I request access to and copy of said document.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dillon Bergin

title: Florida  Freedom of Information Act. Request: Florida Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (University of Florida)

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Florida  Freedom of Information Act. Request: Florida Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (University of Florida)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the { Florida  Freedom of Information Act }, I hereby request the following records:

- A copy of any and all contracts (including associated amendments and exhibits) awarded to Pepsi, Coca-Cola, or any subdivision thereof, for the provision of beverages or other goods in any facilities under the purview of this organization, including all activities and buildings associated with athletics, sports, dining services, or otherwise. If this agency does not have a contract with either of the named companies, please provide the equivalent agreement with the currently employed company.
- If the contract(s) was cancelled, any and all materials related to its cancellation.
- If the contract was cancelled, the statement from the university about cancellation.



The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within { 5 days }.

Sincerely,

{ Kayla Henson }

title: NORTHSHORE SCHOOL DISTRICT – (2020) Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including the District Responses for the year 2020

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: NORTHSHORE SCHOOL DISTRICT – (2020) Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including the District Responses for the year 2020
communications.communication:
NORTHSHORE SCHOOL DISTRICT – (2020) Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including the District Responses for the year 2020

Via email: dhale@nsd.org

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act [RCW 42.56] I hereby request the following records:

1.	I request a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by your agency in the year 2020 and a complete electronic copy of your agency's Responses to each of these Public Records Requests for the year 2020.

Note: Parents and students seeking GRADES and/or TRANSCRIPTS in the year 2020 can be excluded from this request.

PRODUCTION AND DELIVERY OF ELECTRONIC RECORDS

The use of 3rd party “portals” (Such as GOVQA or NEXTREQUEST) for communication and production of records in response to a public records request is optional for the requestor in the State of Washington. Respectfully we decline to use any 3rd party "portal" system, specifically GOVQA and NEXTREQUEST. Please provide all records electronically via direct email attachment, or via no password, no registration internet cloud-based download link.

Please do not direct or invite us to use, register for, or communicate with your agency via any 3rd party portal including but not limited to FOIAOnline, GovQA, NextRequest, FOIAExpress, JustFOIA FOIADirect, WebForm, or any other commercial 3rd party records portal service.

 RCW 42.56.080 - Identifiable records—Facilities for copying—Availability of public records.
 
"...Agencies shall honor requests received in person during an agency's normal office hours, or by mail or email, for identifiable public records unless exempted by provisions of this chapter. No official format is required for making a records request; however, agencies may recommend that requestors submit requests using an agency provided form or web page."

This public records request is being made via email. This public records request will be honored and fulfilled by your agency via email as requested or relief will be sought per statute.

NATIVE ELECTRONIC FORMAT

Please provide all identified public records in their NATIVE electronic format. Unless the records exist IN PAPER FORM ONLY, DO NOT instead create new records by printing native stored electronic files, then scanning and re-printing these newly scanned prints only to reproduce them in again in electronic production.

FEES

In the event that there are fees, please inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling the request in strict compliance with all provisions of the Washington State Public Records Act.

EXEMPTION - FAMILY EDUCATIONAL RIGHTS AND PRIVACY ACT (FERPA)

Take caution with the broad application of redaction and withholding of identified public records claiming "global FERPA" exemptions. When an agency claims an exemption for an entire record or portion of one, it must inform the requestor of the statutory exemption and provide a brief explanation of how the exemption applies to the record or portion withheld. RCW 42.17.310(4)/42.56.210(3). The brief explanation should cite the statute the agency claims grant an exemption from disclosure. The brief explanation should provide enough information for a requestor to make a threshold determination of whether the claimed exemption is proper. Global, nonspecific claims of exemption such as "FERPA" are insufficient. One way to properly provide a brief explanation of the withheld record or redaction is for the agency to provide a withholding index. It identifies the type of record, its date and number of pages, and the author or recipient of the record (unless their identity is exempt). The withholding index should allow a requestor to make a threshold determination of whether the agency has properly invoked the exemption. There are several exceptions to the FERPA exemption and any agency silently withholding large swaths of public records citing "FERPA!" without providing the original identified record, properly redacted, or if withheld in its entirety, providing a record description and page count or record length, will be challenged in accordance with RCW 42.56.550 if a reasonably detailed withholding index or exemption log is not included.

EXEMPTION LOGS

Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld.

COMMERCIAL PURPOSE DECLARATION

The Washington State Public Records Act prohibits the disclosure of “lists of individuals” for a commercial purpose (RCW 42.56.070(8)). I declare this public records request is not being made for any commercial purpose whatsoever. Also, this public records request is not being made for a "list of individuals." This declaration satisfies all requirements of RCW 42.56 regarding prohibitions on lists and commercial purposes. No additional commercial purpose declaration will be completed for this public records request. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

communications.subject: Public Record Request Dated 12.2.2022- All 2020 PRRs
communications.communication:
This message is being sent on behalf of Doug Hale

Dear 137064-90576794@requests.muckrock.com,

The District is in receipt of your public records request dated 12/2/2022. Your request is for the following records:


1. I request a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by your agency in the year 2020 and a complete electronic copy of your agency's Responses to each of these Public Records Requests for the year 2020.


Note: Parents and students seeking GRADES and/or TRANSCRIPTS in the year 2020 can be excluded from this request.

You have requested “please provide all identified public records in their NATIVE electronic format.” The vast majority of records the District has disclosed in response to public records requests have not been produced in native format, and instead were produced in formats such as .pdf or hard-copy. You have requested “a complete electronic copy of the District’s Responses” to public records requests during the time period in question (2020), and such responses typically did not contain native format records. Since your request is in conflict with the District's production of records, the District interprets your request as seeking the District’s previous disclosure communications in their native format when they were sent electronically, recognizing that those disclosure communications will often contain non-native files. For example, the District would produce to you the native format email of its response to a given public records request, which may include attached responsive records in pdf format that were actually produced to a requestor. Please let me know if you disagree with this interpretation of your request.
Next, please be aware that the District may no longer possess copies of older public records requests and/or District responses. In that event, the District would be unable to disclose copies of such requests and responses. The District retains records pursuant to the Core Retention Schedule of two years.
Per RCW 42.56.120, the District charges the following fees for copies of records:
1. Fifteen cents per page for photocopies of public records, printed copies of electronic public records when requested by the person requesting records, or for the use of agency equipment to photocopy public records;
2. Ten cents per page for public records scanned into an electronic format or for the use of District equipment to scan the records;
3. Five cents per each four electronic files or attachment uploaded to email, cloud-based data storage service, or other means of electronic delivery;
4. Ten cents per gigabyte for the transmission of public records in an electronic format or for the use of District equipment to send the records electronically; and
5. The actual cost of any digital storage media or device provided by the District, the actual cost of any container or envelope used to mail the copies to the requestor, and the actual postage or delivery charge.
Any applicable copying costs must be received by the District before the District discloses records. Additionally, RCW 42.56.120 authorizes the District to require a deposit of up to ten percent of the total estimated costs of providing copies for a request. The District has not yet had an opportunity to determine how many responsive records there will be, or what the total estimated cost of fulfilling the request will be. Prior to providing a first installment of records for this request, we will contact you to let you know the total estimated cost and the deposit amount due. Following receipt of the deposit, the District will require payment of any applicable copying costs before producing installments.
Pursuant to RCW 42.56.120(4) we are charging a 10% deposit in order to produce about 1184 records. The deposit due is $1.48, the total amount due is $14.80. Please contact me at 425-408-7605 to coordinate a deposit. If I do not hear from you by January 10, 2023, the District will close your request consistent with RCW 42.56.120.
If you have any questions I can be reached at 425-408-7605.
​
Sincerely,
​
Doug Hale
Executive Director of Human Resources
Public Records Officer
___________________________________________


Have a pleasant day.

Elaine Gisle
Executive Administrative Assistant
Human Resources  |  Northshore School District
Phone: 425.408.7621<callto:425.408.7621>

Note: any records previously requested via the public records act that have yet to be produced by your district cannot be legally destroyed and ARE NOT SUBJECT TO THECORE RETENTION SCHEDULE. I suspect based on various outstanding records requests I see pending with your district, (and the fact that your district must retain all responses to public records requests for 2 years)  ONLY A LIMITED SUBSET OF PUBLIC RECORDS in your district can be destroyed based on the core retention schedule for the foreseeable future. Please consider this as affirmative notice.

Thank you.

communications.subject: OPRA Request
communications.communication:
MuckRock News,


I, the Custodian of Records, received your OPRA requests (one dated 1/31/23
and the other dated 2/15/23) on February 23, 2023 via regular mail.  As
such, the seven (7) business day deadline to respond to your request is
March 6, 2023.  This response to your request is being provided to you on
the day I received your request.



Your request sought, in pertinent part, access to the following NJIT
records:



*“A copy of any and all contracts (including associated amendments and
exhibits) awarded to Pepsi, Coca-Cola, or any subdivision thereof, for the
provision  of beverages or other goods in any facilities under the purview
of this organization, including all activities and buildings associated
with athletics, sports, dining services, or otherwise. .....**.”*



*Response*:

The following record is being provided in its entirety and is responsive to
your request :


University Sponsorship Agreement with Pepsi  (27 pages).



The record provided is being transmitted to you via email pursuant to your
request.  There is no cost associated with this request.



If your request for access to a government record has been denied or
unfilled within the seven (7) business days required by law, you have a
right to challenge the decision by NJIT to deny access.  At your option,
you may either institute a proceeding in the Superior Court of New Jersey
or file a complaint with the Government Records Council (GRC) by completing
the Denial of Access Complaint Form.  You may contact the GRC by toll-free
telephone at 866-850-0511, by mail at P.O. Box 819, Trenton, NJ, 08625, by
email at grc@dca.state.nj.us , or at their web site at www.state.nj.us/grc.
The GRC can also answer other questions about the law.  All questions
regarding complaints filed in Superior Court should be directed to the
Court Clerk in your County.
Regards,



Clara Williams, Custodian of Records

Office of General Counsel

Fenster Hall, Room 480

NJ Institute of Technology

323 Dr Martin L King Blvd

Newark, NJ 07102

973/596-5461
973/642-4056 FAX

Dear Chris Gelardi: 
Please be advised that a response to this request has been uploaded. 
Records Access Officer

title: Genetic Extinction Information

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Genetic Extinction Information
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The search results of all email servers for the query of string "genetic extinction" in the subject or body fields of all mailboxes and folders, IMAP directories or other subdivisions within all email accounts, between January 1, 2016 and January 1, 2018.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.


Sincerely,

Craig Neef

Dear Mr. Neef,

 

Please find attached a copy of your request as well as our office's final response. Because the responsive documents are too large to send over email we need to send them out over our secure website SAFE.APPS.mil. communications.subject: Your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Request 2021-02662-F
communications.communication:
Dear Mr./Ms. Neef, 
We received your 26-Mar-18 Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request 2021-02662-F on 04-May-21, which seeks the following: OSD/JS Referral 18-F-0763.The search results of all email servers for the query of string "genetic extinction" in the subject or body fields of all mailboxes and folders, IMAP directories or other subdivisions within all email accounts, between January 1, 2016 and January 1, 2018. 
Select Appropriate Multi-Track paragraph 
Basedon the information you have requested, we placed your request in the Simple processing multi-track.A simple request is one that “can be processed quickly with limited impact onthe responding units.  The request clearly identifies the recordswith no (or few) complicating factors involved. There are few or no responsiverecords. Only one installation is involved and there are no outside OPRs. Thereare no classified or nongovernment records. No deliberative process/privilegedmaterials are involved.  The responsiverecords contain no (or limited) personal privacy information and do not comefrom a Privacy Act system of records.  Notime extensions are anticipated.” 
Weestimate we can provide a response to your request within 20 working days. Ourpolicy is to process requests within their respective tracks in the order inwhich we receive them. FOIA request are processed as quickly as possible. Wewill advise you if we cannot provide a response within the FOIA statutorytimeline. Wehave placed you in the “Educationalor Noncommercial Scientific Institution or News Media” fee category forprocessing.  Under this category, you maybe charged for all duplication (paper) costs. The first 100 pages of duplication are furnished without charge.  If you disagree andinterpret this response as an adverse action, you may write to the Secretary ofthe Air Force, Thru: 875 N. Randolph st. Arlington, VA 22203 within 90 calendar days from the date of this letter.  Include in the appeal your reasons forreconsideration, and attach a copy of this letter. You may also submit yourappeal on line at the Air Force’s Public Access Link: https://efoia.cce.af.mil/. (https://efoia.cce.af.mil/) You may contact the Air Force FOIAPublic Liaison Officer, Ms. Adriane Paris, concerning this final response at AirForce FOIA Public Liaison Office, 1800 Air Force Pentagon, Washington, DC20330-1800 or DAF.FOIA@us.af.mil or(703) 614-8500. You may also seek dispute resolution services from the Officeof Government Information Services, and can find information on this Office at (mailto:DAF.FOIA@us.af.mil) https://www.archives.gov/ogis/mediation-program/request-assistance.  Using the dispute resolution services, willnot affect your appeal rights. (https://www.archives.gov/ogis/mediation-program/request-assistance) Direct questions to tyrone.reed.1@us.af.mil  or call [703-835-6599] and reference the above FOIA case number. Sincerely, //SIGNED// Tyrone D Reed, Civ, DAF 
Freedom of Information Act Manager

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: McLennan County Sheriff's Department   Michelle Stough
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Employment history, all write ups, all complaints against conduct of Michelle Stough, day of hiring, day of exit. History including any family members employed by MCSO.
I sent a request to HR and they referred me back to you. 
B

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Bernadette Feazell

title: Police Staff Roster (February 2023) (Sedro-woolley Police Department)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Police Staff Roster (February 2023) (Sedro-woolley Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Staff roster including but not limited to first and last names, job titles, areas of assignment, and badge, serial, and other identifying numbers. In order of preference, I would prefer that this data be provided as: plain text with comma-separated-values (i.e., a "CSV" file), OpenDocument spreadsheet, Excel spreadsheet, or the native electronic format of the software from which this information is retrieved in fulfillment of my request. I specifically request that you not create a new record for me by rendering to PDF or by printing your electronic record then scanning it to make a series of images of the printed data.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

title: Police Records Request

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Police Records Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Staff roster including but not limited to first and last names, job titles, areas of assignment, and badge, serial, and other identifying numbers. In order of preference, I would prefer that this data be provided as: OpenDocument spreadsheet, plain text with comma-separated-values (i.e., a "CSV" file), Excel spreadsheet, or the native electronic format of the software from which this information is retrieved in fulfillment of my request. I specifically request that you not create a new record for me by rendering to PDF or by printing your electronic record then scanning it to make a series of images of the printed data.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.  I understand merely stating that I will not be using records for commercial purposes is not sufficient, and so further details are: to use this public record to inform myself and the public at large of whom we, the people, employ to work as peace officers in the city of Spokane, what those employee's general assignments are, and how they are identified by your agency when names are not available (e.g., when one is identified only by "badge number").

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Anon Koo

Good morning: 
This is to acknowledge receipt of your January 2, 2023, message regarding your public records request assigned tracking number P011870-122122.  In your correspondence, you clarified that your request is seeking information/records for employees of the Spokane Police Department only and not all City employees.  We appreciate the clarification.  In further reviewing your request, some additional clarification is required. 
Are you seeking a roster of only uniformed Spokane Police Department employees or civilian employees in the SPD as well?  Your request references " . . . badge, serial, and other identifying numbers."  We are unclear as to what you mean by "serial."   Officer badge numbers and employee ID numbers can be provided, however, other than those numbers, what do you mean by "any other identifying numbers" and serial"?  Lastly, your request references " . . . areas of assignment . .".  We interpret this to mean departments or units of the Spokane Police Department (for example, "Major Crimes," "Patrol," "SWAT," etc.)  If our understanding is incorrect, please clarify as to you what you are seeking with respect to this portion of your request. 
\If you could provide the additional clarifications sought above at your earliest opportunity, we would be very appreciative, as this will all staff to move forward with your request to provide the information you are seeking. 
Sincerely, 
Laurie Farnsworth 
Spokane Deputy City Clerk

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request #P011870-122122
communications.communication:
Your understanding is correct.  To clarify, I am pertaining to only uniformed officers of Spokane Police Department employees.  I also pertain to badge numbers; sorry for the confusion in wording. Finally, it is correct that I am looking for departments or units of the Spokane Police Department.

Thank you,
Anon

Good evening: 
This is a follow up to my January 3 correspondence to you regarding your public records request assigned tracking number P011870-122122.  This is to also acknowledge your January 6 message wherein you provided additional clarification of your request. 
Also, regarding your message of January 17, since the second week of January, I have been performing in the capacity of Acting City Clerk while the City Clerk is out on FMLA leave.  These added responsibilities have had an impact on the my available time to devote to public records requests. 
Your public records request states that any records received under this request will not be used for commercial purposes, and we acknowledge the additional information you provided as to the intended use for any records received.  However, as you may already be aware, an appellate court decision, SEIU Healthcare 775 NW v. DSHS, 193 Wn. App. 377 (2016) holds that when a city receives a request for documents that includes a list of individuals, the City is required to determine whether the list will be used for “commercial purposes.” The case concluded that a requestor has a commercial purpose if the requestor intends to use the list for direct or indirect profit-making activity, regardless of whether the requestor intends to contact the individuals on the list or even if the individuals are personally affected by the release of the list or not. If the City has some indication that a requester intends to use a list of individuals for a commercial purpose, we are required to “investigate further” before we disclose that list. 
Although, as I stated above, you have provided some information as to your intended use of any provided records, we ask that you fill out and return the attached Commercial Purpose declaration, which includes additional questions we use to make an independent evaluation as to whether or not your purpose is commercial or not. 

To avoid unnecessary delay in obtaining records for your request, please return the completed declaration at your earliest opportunity. We will follow up with you within five business days as to the validity of the stated purpose(s) relating to your request. Please return the completed declaration within 30 days of today's date, or by February 24, 2023.  We anticipate the responsive records will be available approximately 14 days from the date of receipt of a completed declaration determined to be valid.  If responsive records become available sooner than the estimated 14-day window, we will let you know. 
Sincerely, 
Laurie Farnsworth 
Spokane Deputy City Clerk

title: Communications Relating to the Appointment of Sheila Stinson as a District Judge for Oklahoma County

communications.subject: Oklahoma Open Records Act Request: Communications Relating to the Appointment of Sheila Stinson as a District Judge for Oklahoma County
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Oklahoma Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All communications to/from Governor Stitt and/or his staff relating to the appointment of Sheila Stinson as a District Judge for Oklahoma County from 1-1-2018 to 7-6-2022.

All communication including Jason Reese (former General Counsel to Governor Kevin Stitt) and/or his staff relating to the appointment of Sheila Stinson as a District Judge for Oklahoma County or any other appointment of district judges for Oklahoma County from 1-1-2018 to 7-6-2022.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

JudgeWatch

title: Police Staff Roster (January 2023) (Snohomish County Sheriff's Office)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Police Staff Roster (January 2023) (Snohomish County Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Staff roster including but not limited to first and last names, job titles, areas of assignment, and badge, serial, and other identifying numbers. In order of preference, I would prefer that this data be provided as: plain text with comma-separated-values (i.e., a "CSV" file), OpenDocument spreadsheet, Excel spreadsheet, or the native electronic format of the software from which this information is retrieved in fulfillment of my request. I specifically request that you not create a new record for me by rendering to PDF or by printing your electronic record then scanning it to make a series of images of the printed data.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

 Your Request Information 
Description of Request: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Staff roster including but not limited to first and last names, job titles, areas of assignment, and badge, serial, and other identifying numbers. In order of preference, I would prefer that this data be provided as: plain text with comma-separated-values (i.e., a "CSV" file), OpenDocument spreadsheet, Excel spreadsheet, or the native electronic format of the software from which this information is retrieved in fulfillment of my request. I specifically request that you not create a new record for me by rendering to PDF or by printing your electronic record then scanning it to make a series of images of the printed data.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

 
In accordance with the Public Records Act, RCW 42.56.520, this communication acknowledges receipt of your Public Records Act (PRA) request received by Snohomish County on January 09, 2023. 

This request has been assigned tracking number K084200-010923. Please use this number in any communications concerning this request. 

Specifically, you requested: 

Staff roster including but not limited to first and last names, job titles, areas of assignment, and badge, serial, and other identifying numbers. In order of preference, I would prefer that this data be provided as: plain text with comma-separated-values (i.e., a "CSV" file), OpenDocument spreadsheet, Excel spreadsheet, or the native electronic format of the software from which this information is retrieved in fulfillment of my request. I specifically request that you not create a new record for me by rendering to PDF or by printing your electronic record then scanning it to make a series of images of the printed data. 

In order to respond to this request, we need additional information to allow us to locate possibly responsive records. Are you seeking records from the Snohomish County Sheriff's office? If not, please let me know which department you are seeking records from. 

Please note that absent clarification from you by January 19, 2023, this public records request will be considered abandoned and will be closed. 
Sincerely, 
Stacy Irwin 
Central Human Resources 
Public Records Specialist

title: Civil Asset Forfeiture (Reno Police Department)

communications.subject: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Civil Asset Forfeiture (Reno Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Accounting records or statistics on seized real estate, vehicles, firearms, funds in bank accounts and seizures made by the department , as well as seizures made by federal authorities where the department  receives a share of said assets or monies

-Any annual reports produced on the civil asset forfeiture program.

-Documents showing the balance of any funds currently in the  Civil Asset Forfeiture fund.

-Itemized spenditure  or distribution of funds 
 
-A list of all items seized through civil asset forfeiture and retained for use by the 
.

-Please also include any information relating to contested seizures. This request does not include court documents for individual forfeiture cases.

This request is for the last 10 years

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jordan

title: FOIA - John D. Lofton Jr. (Federal Bureau of Investigation)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA - John D. Lofton Jr. (Federal Bureau of Investigation)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records mentioning John D. Lofton Jr. (May 26, 1941 – September 17, 2014) - American Conservative pundit and newspaper editor (see: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Lofton )

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

J Ader

Supporting documentation **

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBIâ€™s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBIâ€™s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the â€˜Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request toolâ€™ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] -  RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1553780-000
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.  Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on “Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request” on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI’s FOIPA Program is searching the FBI’s indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 98 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 947 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 2,011 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 2,360 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

title: James Rhodes

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: James Rhodes
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records relating to or mentioning James Allen Rhodes (September 13, 1909 – March 4, 2001), an American Republican politician from Ohio, and as of 2006 one of only six US state governors to serve 4 four-year terms in office. (The other five were Edwin Edwards, George Wallace, Jim Hunt, Bill Janklow, and Terry Branstad.) Rhodes is tied for the fourth longest gubernatorial tenure in post-Constitutional U.S. history at 5,840 days. As governor in 1970, Rhodes sent National Guard troops onto the Kent State University campus at the request of Kent, Ohio's mayor, after the ROTC building was burned down by unknown arsonists on May 2. On May 4, four students were killed and nine others were wounded by the Guard. One victim, Dean Kahler, suffered permanent paralysis. 

Proof of death is not required, as the subject was born over 100 years ago.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Best

title: Police Staff Roster (February 2023) (Lynnwood Police Department)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Police Staff Roster (February 2023) (Lynnwood Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Staff roster including but not limited to first and last names, job titles, areas of assignment, and badge, serial, and other identifying numbers. In order of preference, I would prefer that this data be provided as: plain text with comma-separated-values (i.e., a "CSV" file), OpenDocument spreadsheet, Excel spreadsheet, or the native electronic format of the software from which this information is retrieved in fulfillment of my request. I specifically request that you not create a new record for me by rendering to PDF or by printing your electronic record then scanning it to make a series of images of the printed data.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

title: License Plate Reader Vendors (Aurora Police Department)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1)	The name of any vendors or manufacturers that your department purchases license plate reader technology from. This may include but is not limited to cameras, software, or other technology to support automated reading of license plates in the areas your department serves.

2)	The name of any vendors that your department partners with to install or perform maintenance on license plate reading technology (e.g., cameras and other software). These partners may also be known as integrators.

3)	Where available, the contracts or purchase agreements with the vendors or parties included in the above two bullets.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Chip McCoy

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Police Staff Roster (February 2023) (Shoreline Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Staff roster including but not limited to first and last names, job titles, areas of assignment, and badge, serial, and other identifying numbers. In order of preference, I would prefer that this data be provided as: plain text with comma-separated-values (i.e., a "CSV" file), OpenDocument spreadsheet, Excel spreadsheet, or the native electronic format of the software from which this information is retrieved in fulfillment of my request. I specifically request that you not create a new record for me by rendering to PDF or by printing your electronic record then scanning it to make a series of images of the printed data.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: P091337-021423
communications.communication:
Thank you for your interest in obtaining public records held by the King County Sheriff’s Office. Your request has been received and is being processed. Your request was received in this office on February 14, 2023 and given the reference number P091337-021423 for tracking purposes. 
 
Within five business days (excluding holidays) after receiving your request, we will: 
 
 
  * Provide the record(s); 
  * Or Acknowledge your request and give you a reasonable estimate of how long it will take to respond; 
  * Or Deny the request in writing, stating the reasons for the denial (this could also include a denial of part of your request and a granting of the remainder). 
Record(s) Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Staff roster including but not limited to first and last names, job titles, areas of assignment, and badge, serial, and other identifying numbers. In order of preference, I would prefer that this data be provided as: plain text with comma-separated-values (i.e., a "CSV" file), OpenDocument spreadsheet, Excel spreadsheet, or the native electronic format of the software from which this information is retrieved in fulfillment of my request. I specifically request that you not create a new record for me by rendering to PDF or by printing your electronic record then scanning it to make a series of images of the printed data.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse 
 
Once the records have been collected, we will notify you of any copying charges. Any records or portion of records that are exempt from disclosure will be withheld or redacted. We will specify the exemption that applies to any documents withheld or redactions made. 
 
 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the King County Sheriff’s Office online request system. 
 
King County Sheriff’s Office | Public Disclosure Unit 
 
 (206) 263-2103 | www.kingcounty.gov/sheriff (https://u8387795.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=tVZK-2BDMrxhcb-2BNvwVODlUOe5OikZUtDxEqXUwqpxORo2C-2BNbbhB9XcAImTNZFatAg1Ny_d12HIyC7RIpSw2upKQW-2FZTA41I-2FlQus9fBY7qmvWrweXjXqDsdWJV97pUoM48zjMNbtfO76u5Aem1wfmqcAAUbG1IhBxdzrl2U0mlQzp9sMtKjFzZ1egR-2FQhRPKwjWQopGDHLEgvmcYcy87QrZKfV1pkcasRrA6zFuwrGw-2F0ns5jU8Rk4aMreiLzqywAByQqj3-2BWtMznuDabluuMBU2VtiR-2F3vjhb3a9GoRDernlfWlix1WtSWLIy4bp7FLHILOMtolnpBZnZLZNw6Lg8cuXsbj0EpNeI49HtVSkZSto-2F6qUcFJ3TL2xUl5LFUsaurMC6jQ1o5bPFXbMgOJZO3KdZkYNFk0x2vQYcA7Chp8Ijpm4fnxdaV2OZsy0Z4W5mXNd)

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: P091337-021423
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
Subject: Public Disclosure Request Reference# P091337-021423 Thank you for your request made via the King County Sheriff’s Office (KCSO) Online Request System on February 14, 2023. You requested: “To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

Staff roster including but not limited to first and last names, job titles, areas of assignment, and badge, serial, and other identifying numbers. In order of preference, I would prefer that this data be provided as: plain text with comma-separated-values (i.e., a "CSV" file), OpenDocument spreadsheet, Excel spreadsheet, or the native electronic format of the software from which this information is retrieved in fulfillment of my request. I specifically request that you not create a new record for me by rendering to PDF or by printing your electronic record then scanning it to make a series of images of the printed data. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Rose Terse The KCSO Public Disclosure Unit has located the following records responsive to your request: 
Copy of KCSOEmployeeRoster.xlsx 

Please log in to the Records Center at the following link to retrieve the records: Public Records Request - P091337-021423 Once you log in and go to your request, you will find the uploaded records in the "Files" section. If you are using a mobile device and are having trouble downloading or seeing the records, we recommend using a laptop or desktop computer to access the documents. To open and review PDF documents you will need an application that can view PDF documents. PLEASE NOTE: Per RCW 42.56.120(4), the KCSO reserves the right to close a records request after 30 days if a requester does not inspect, view, download, and/or pick up the records we provide. There is no obligation for us to continue producing records that are not being collected by a requester. 
RCW 42.56.120(4) states that if an installment of a records request is not claimed or reviewed, the agency is not obligated to fulfill the balance of the request. 
WAC 44-14-04006(1) states that a records request has been fulfilled and can be closed if an entirely unclear request has not been clarified, a request or installment has not been claimed or reviewed, or the requester cancels the request. Please reply to this message or log in to the Online Request System if you have any questions.This completes your request. Sincerely, Heidi Germano | Project/Program Manager II | Public Disclosure Unit 206-263-2634 | www.kingcounty.gov/sheriff 

If you wish to track or respond to this request, please login to the Online Request System.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Mary Ellen Abrecht
communications.communication:
Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on "Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request" on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@ic.fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI's FOIPA Program is searching the FBI's indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 134 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 523 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 1,335 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 1,875 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
Record/Information Dissemination Section (RIDS) FBI-Information Management Division
170 Marcel Drive, Winchester, VA 22602-4843
Direct: (540) 868-4593
Fax: (540) 868-4391
Questions E-mail: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

communications.subject: Idaho Public Records Act Request: Coplink Idaho (Coeur D’alene Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Idaho Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I'm looking for documents pertaining to the department's usage the COPLINK or COPLINKX software from January 1, 2018 until the date this request is processed.

1. Invoices or receipts for the purchase of any the COPLINK or COPLINKX product/service
2. Communications, internal memos or directives that mention Coplink, Face Match, or FaceMatch
3. MOU's or Information Sharing Agreements about COPLINK or COPLINKX
4. Brochures or product/service specifications about COPLINK.
5. Privacy policies,  manuals, briefings mentioning COPLINK or COPLINKX

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra

We have determined that responding to your request will exceed two (2) hours of labor which, pursuant to I.C. § 74-102(10)(a), is provided without charge.  Since the estimate of the actual labor associated with responding to your request exceeds two (2) hours, you are required to pay for the time exceeding two (2) hours at the lowest hourly rate for a city employee(s) who is qualified to research, retrieve, review, redact, and remit the records requested.  In order to comply with your request as written, I estimate that it will cost $619.51 to review all the emails. 
As soon as the City is in receipt of a check for that amount, staff will proceed with the actual labor associated with the records requested. If the actual costs are more than the estimated amount, then you will be required to pay the full balance of costs owed before you receive the copies. If the actual costs are less than your estimated payment, then the unused amount will be refunded to you. 
There may be a less expensive way for you to obtain this information. You may narrow the scope of your request. 
Your request will be considered automatically withdrawn if you do not notify us in writing within ten business days from the date of this letter that you: 
(a) accept the charges; 
(b) wish to modify your request; 

Thank you for your patience in awaiting this information. 
Sincerely, 
Alison Palmer 
City of Coeur d'Alene

The City of Coeur d'Alene has reviewed its files and has located responsive records to your request. Please log in to the City of Coeur d'Alene Public Records Center at the following link to retrieve the appropriate responsive documents. Per our phone conversation I have not included emails as there would be fees involved, .1. The invoices are attached. We pay Spokane Police Department not Forensic Logic. 
2. We do NOT use Face Match at all. We also do NOT use Shot Spotter. 
3. There is no record of MOU’s. 
4. Spokane operates / maintains Coplink by Forensic Logic. They may have this information along with the company; we do not have anything like this. There are user manuals on: http://arrest.spokanepolice.org/usermanuals.html that is open to the public. Training that occurred was in a classroom setting and mostly hands-on. There were no handouts from the instructor. 
5. Our Policy can be downloaded at: https://www.cdaid.org/files/Police/Policies/RELEASE_20221207_T120521_Coeur_d_Alene_PD_Policy_Manual.pdf. 
Legacy Coplink was discontinued 2/8/2023 so that information is not available.

City of Coeur d'Alene

title: Police Staff Roster (January 2023) (Burien Police Department)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Police Staff Roster (January 2023) (Burien Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Staff roster including but not limited to first and last names, job titles, areas of assignment, and badge, serial, and other identifying numbers. In order of preference, I would prefer that this data be provided as: plain text with comma-separated-values (i.e., a "CSV" file), OpenDocument spreadsheet, Excel spreadsheet, or the native electronic format of the software from which this information is retrieved in fulfillment of my request. I specifically request that you not create a new record for me by rendering to PDF or by printing your electronic record then scanning it to make a series of images of the printed data.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

--- Please respond above this line --- 
Subject: Public Disclosure Request Reference# P089503-011023 Thank you for your request made via the King County Sheriff’s Office (KCSO) Online Request System on January 09, 2023. You requested: “Burien Police Department 
Washington Public Records Act Office 
14905 6th Ave. SW 
Burien, WA 98166 
January 9, 2023 
To Whom It May Concern: 
Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 
Staff roster including but not limited to first and last names, job titles, areas of assignment, and badge, serial, and other identifying numbers. In order of preference, I would prefer that this data be provided as: plain text with comma-separated-values (i.e., a "CSV" file), OpenDocument spreadsheet, Excel spreadsheet, or the native electronic format of the software from which this information is retrieved in fulfillment of my request. I specifically request that you not create a new record for me by rendering to PDF or by printing your electronic record then scanning it to make a series of images of the printed data. 
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 
Sincerely, 
Rose Terse 
View request history, upload responsive documents, and report problems here: 
https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fburien-police-department-28507%252Fpolice-staff-roster-january-2023-burien-police-department-138569%252F%253Femail%253Dtheodore.boe%252540kingcounty.gov&url_auth_token=AAGK3y_zBSw8e3c3dQ6pk83pszg%3A1pEtN3%3AIjtp-tZ5rQOzi1fLEqweOI8cLsOqIKicBcfiv1dL_ts 
If prompted for a passcode, please enter: 
WCCFYRGF 
Filed via MuckRock.com 
E-mail (Preferred): 138569-25005748@requests.muckrock.com 
PLEASE NOTE OUR NEW ADDRESS 
For mailed responses, please address (see note): 
MuckRock News 
DEPT MR 138569 
263 Huntington Ave 
Boston, MA 02115 
PLEASE NOTE: This request is not filed by a MuckRock staff member, but is being sent through MuckRock by the above in order to better track, share, and manage public records requests. Also note that improperly addressed (i.e., with the requester's name rather than "MuckRock News" and the department number) requests might be returned as undeliverable.” We would like to clarify with you whether the list you are requesting may be used for commercial purposes. RCW Chapter 42.56 governs the disclosure of public records in Washington State. The Public Disclosure Act is generally construed liberally to promote access to public records ( RCW 42.56.030). However, RCW 42.56.070(8) specifically prohibits the disclosure of “lists of individuals requested for commercial purposes”. This section “does not distinguish between different types of commercial purposes”. 

Prior to providing you with the list you requested, please complete and return the attached Affidavit form. Once your signed Affidavit form is received, we will process your request. We will consider your request for this list as abandoned/closed unless we hear from you by February 21, 2023. 
PLEASE NOTE: Per RCW 42.56.120(4) , the KCSO reserves the right to close a records request after 30 days if a requester does not inspect, view, download, and/or pick up the records we provide. There is no obligation for us to continue producing records that are not being collected by a requester. 
RCW 42.56.120(4) states that if an installment of a records request is not claimed or reviewed, the agency is not obligated to fulfill the balance of the request. 
WAC 44-14-04006(1) states that a records request has been fulfilled and can be closed if an entirely unclear request has not been clarified, a request or installment has not been claimed or reviewed, or the requester cancels the request. Please reply to this message or log in to the Online Request System if you have any questions or would like to clarify or cancel this request. Sincerely, Janet Arnette | Project/Program Manager II | Public Disclosure Unit (206)477-2620 | www.kingcounty.gov/sheriff

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request #P089503-011023
communications.communication:
Hello,

As I mentioned earlier, this request is being made in the public interest for non-commercial purposes and the records will be made freely available to the general public through the website MuckRock. As such, I cannot "prevent others from using records for commercial purposes" if they choose to do so, as requested by your affidavit document. However, my understanding is that RCW 42.56.070(8) only covers "lists of individuals requested for commercial purposes" so this should not be a problem.

Thanks,
Rose
